  2. Here’s what to know about the presidential debate and how to watch it  The Hill
  3. Monday briefing: Strap in or run for the hills – it’s the return of the Biden v Trump debates  The Guardian
  4. Trump vs. Biden Rematch: Lessons From Their 2020 Debates  The Wall Street Journal
  5. Washington Week with The Atlantic full episode, 6/21/24 | Washington Week with The Atlantic  PBS

item.title: Israel winding down Gaza operations as focus shifts to Hezbollah
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced that Israel's military will now focus on redeploying troops to the country's northern region, where tensions with Hezbollah have intensified. Additionally, residents who were forced to leave their homes will be allowed to return. "If we can, we'll do this by diplomatic means, if not it'll be achieved in another way," Netanyahu said, reflecting the growing tensions between Israel and Hezbollah over the past several weeks.

item.title: Labor seeks to raise incoming governor general’s salary by more than $214,000
item.description:
Albanese government wants bill passed to lift Sam Mostyn’s salary by 43%, in line with estimated average of chief justice of the high court’s salary

  • Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates
  • Get our morning and afternoon news emails, free app or daily news podcast

The Albanese government is seeking to raise the pay for the incoming governor general, Sam Mostyn, by more than $214,000, saying the change is appropriate because she is not receiving the same sort of additional pensions that previous officeholders have enjoyed.

Mostyn will be sworn into her new office on 1 July. Patrick Gorman, the assistant minister to the prime minister, introduced a bill into federal parliament on Monday morning which would raise the salary for the governor general from $495,000 to $709,017.

Sign up for Guardian Australia’s free morning and afternoon email newsletters for your daily news roundup
